item.title: 5 Best Free Games Similar To Stardew Valley
item.description:
Of all the farming/life simulators out there, no other game has had as much success as Stardew Valley . Created by a single developer, the game captivated players of all kinds with its cute pixel art aesthetic, heartwarming character stories, and surprising amount of depth. While it remains the king of the genre, sometimes it's nice to take a step into a completely different world, and with so many games out there, that purchase decision can be tricky, as players want to get the most out of their money while also playing a quality game.

Thankfully, several free games that capture similar elements or themes as Stardew Valley , without ever asking players to spend a penny. There are simplistic sims that strip away all the complexity in the name of comfort, extensive RPGs that still maintain the cozy communal feel, and large open worlds where players can carve out a life for themselves surrounded by nature. For players who like to save their pennies, they will have more than enough fun with these games, regardless of whether they are adventuring across the landscape or fixing up their house.

Harvest Town

Farming And Charm On The Go

  • Release Date : 9 Dec 2020
  • Developer : AVIDGamers
  • Platforms : iOS, Android

Harvest Town is an incredibly satisfying mobile farming simulator that feels so close to Stardew Valley that many players could mistake the two at a glance. The town begins as a rundown husk of its former self, and it is up to the player to restore it to its former glory. There's everything from crop cultivation to livestock raising to finishing, but aside from the traditional sim elements, the game also manages to infuse the world with some deep RPG mechanics that make every NPC come alive and allow the world to feel expansive yet compact at the same time.

The general gameplay loop is very similar to Stardew , as players progress by slowly building their home and interacting with the local villagers to build connections. There is also a big emphasis on helping others, as players will be rewarded with more than just lore for seeing some of the character storylines through to their end. With more than a few surprises along the way, and a constantly changing environment, every day in Harvest Town feels completely different from the last and gives players enough content to enjoy without spending a single cent.

Palia

Relaxing In The Home of Your Dreams

Palia
Released
August 10, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
E10+ For Everyone 10+ Due To Alcohol Reference, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Use of Tobacco
Developer(s)
Singularity 6, Inc.
Powered by

Palia invites players into a bright and communal world where crafting, friendship, and discovery intertwine within a lush fantasy setting. The game is entirely free, but despite that, it is still an impressive life sim that manages to blend cozy exploration with satisfying home building, allowing players to construct homes, tend gardens, fish, cook, and uncover the forgotten history of ancient humans.

Where Stardew Valley captures a quieter aspect of rural life, Palia transforms that experience into something far more communal. With multiplayer at the heart of the game, players are encouraged to work together right from the start, slowly mapping out the world and finding out all there is to know about it. The game really goes above and beyond with the customization options, as players have countless choices in terms of decorations and structures, allowing them to make the home of their dreams in this heartwarming fantasy world.

Notes From Province

RPGMaker Meets Comfy Village Sim

  • Release Date : 13 Aug, 2022
  • Developer : BoxFox Studios
  • Platforms : PC

Notes From Province is a cutesy open-world RPG that pulls players into an intriguing world full of places to see and people to meet. The story is grand yet grounded, following Kyme's journey to find a new home while battling a powerful villain with the power to steal the blue from the sky. The game feels like a classic RPG in a lot of ways, but the focus shifts away from constant combat into more puzzle-like exploration, along with some more relaxing simulator mechanics like cooking and fishing.

Fans of Stardew will adore the character interactions, as each NPC has a rich backstory that unfolds over the course of the narrative. For those who really enjoy the more calming aspects of a simulator, there are plenty of gameplay elements that favor a slower, more simplistic approach to give players a break from the exploration and give them a chance to feel close to the world and the people within it.

Fallout Shelter

Surviving Together Underground

Fallout Shelter
Released
June 14, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Mild Violence, Suggestive Themes, Alcohol Reference
Developer(s)
Bethesda Game Studios, Behaviour Interactive
Powered by

Fallout Shelter puts players at the helm of an underground vault in the middle of the wasteland, tasking them with protecting an ever-growing settlement. Anything that players could imagine is possible in the vault, as they have all the tools they need to build whatever rooms and structures that the people require, while also having plenty of additional options to make the subterranean structure look and feel more like a home.

The game is a slight departure from more exploration-focused games in the genre, but it gives just as much satisfaction and feels equally relaxing for players who want to enjoy a simple gameplay loop without much chaos. Also, community is the name of the game in Fallout Shelter , with individual NPCs having their own specific needs that players can accommodate to raise happiness and make their apocalyptic life far less scary.

Sprout Valley

Shrinking Down The Peaceful Living Experience

  • Release Date : September 12, 2023
  • Developer : Zefrost
  • Platforms : Nintendo Switch, PC, macOS, Linux
  • Itch.io link

Sprout Valley is an adorable farming simulator that strips away a lot of the genre's complexity in the name of pure, uninterrupted relaxation. Players play as Nico, a cute little cat who wants nothing more than to live in peace, and with a load of islands to explore, they have plenty of choices for where to set up the perfect getaway. There's crop harvesting and ocean sailing, all within a calming world that is tied together by a straightforward yet intriguing story.

The game never strays into anything too intense. Players can take their time slowly growing produce and trading it with the various NPCs that are dotted around the seas. What makes the game so fun is the number of possibilities there are in such a seemingly small world. The islands are procedurally generated, meaning that no two playthroughs will be exactly the same, allowing the story to remain fresh and the gameplay to consistently feel rewarding again and again.

item.title: Best MPC-24 Loadout in COD Black Ops 7
item.description:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 features a large arsenal of weapons for fans to grind for, customize, and use to compete across Multiplayer and slay hordes in Zombies. From Sniper Rifles to Assault Rifles capable of shredding the competition, there really is a gun for everyone.

On the topic of weapons, Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 also brings back a few blasts from the past, notably some iconic Black Ops 2 weapons like the M8A1 and even the Peacekeeper MK1. However, one returning weapon that now goes by a new name has definitely not gone unnoticed: the MSMC, now referred to as the MPC-24 . This weapon is definitely one you should be using. Here is the best loadout for it in Multiplayer.

Best MPC-24 Loadout in Black Ops 7

The MPC-24 is definitely a good weapon, one that players will not unlock until Level 55, right before Prestiging, unless they spend their handy Unlock Tokens to unlock it permanently. Of all the Submachine Guns in its class, the MPC-24 boasts the second-highest damage per shot, a middle-of-the-pack fire rate , and the best hipfire accuracy.

The weapon also boasts one of the best levels of mobility and handling, with a fast draw speed that rivals many other guns, such as the Peacekeeper MK1, up close. While its damage range drops off more significantly than other SMGs, it still retains the second-best level of damage beyond 23 meters. Here is the recommended build for this weapon:

Best MPC-24 Build

  • 5 Attachment Build:

    • K&S Stalker 57-X (Muzzle)
    • 8.6'' MFS Stratus-X Barrel (Barrel)
    • Quickstep Foregrip (Underbarrel)
    • Sustain-25 Extended Mag (Magazine)
    • EMT3 Agile Laser (Laser)

  • Optional Gunfighter Attachments:

    • Photonic Adaptive Grip (Rear Grip)
    • Viper Wire Stock (Stock)
    • Recoil Sync Unit (Fire Mods)

MPC-24 Loadout Benefits

Of all the attachments in the above build, arguably the best and most surprising attachment has to be the 8.6'' MFS Stratus-X Barrel (Short Jump Barrel). While you should often stay away from barrels that boost headshot damage, mainly because of how much they harm recoil control, this one actually minimizes both vertical and horizontal recoil while also improving recoil stabilization at the cost of body shot damage and bullet velocity.

For headshots, this build is a beast, quickly dispatching opponents and easily becoming one of the strongest weapons in the game. With some extra recoil reduction benefits, a solid Suppressor, and boosts to movement and strafing speed, the MPC-24 becomes a true meta contender.

Enhanced Stats Overview

    • No Mini-Map Firing Ping
    • Increased Headshot Multiplier
    • Increased Vertical & Horizontal Recoil Control
    • Improved Recoil Stabilization
    • Increased Aim Walking Speed
    • Increased Movement Speed & Hipfire Movement Speed

    • Increased Magazine Ammo Capacity
    • Increased Dive to Fire & Slide to Fire Speed
    • Increased ADS & Jumping ADS Speed
    • Increased Strafing Movement Speed
    • Increased Damage Range

Call of Duty: Black Ops 7

item.title: Arc Raiders: Stella Montis Interactive Map
item.description:
Stella Montis is here, and there is a lot to digest! GameRant's interactive map will help you hunt down or avoid those deadly Shredder ARCs, help you find the best weapon and utility cases, and show you how to easily access the top and bottom layers of the map. Toggle categories on and off to help you narrow your search and ensure you find an extraction point before you get knocked out.

This map is a work in progress and is updated regularly.

Recommended Guides

Stella Montis can be a pretty confusing place to navigate and a challenging place to survive. If you need some help getting your feet wet, feel free to check out our recommended guides below.

  • ARC Raiders: In My Image Quest (Where to Find Androids in Stella Montis)
  • Best Weapons In ARC Raiders
  • ARC Raiders Breaking New Grounds Community Event Explained

item.title: Should You Choose Spare or Kill in Dispatch Episode 8?
item.description:
One of the great things about choice-based games is that the choices players make can actually have an impact on the story and also alter character relationships. These choices can give players a different ending than other players online. Towards the end of the final episode in Dispatch , players who are controlling Robert 's every decision will get two choices: Spare or Kill . Here are the outcomes of these choices in Dispatch .

Should You Choose Spare or Kill in Dispatch Episode 8?

After giving Shroud the Astral Pulse , if you have either romanced Invisigal or have trust in her, she will take the bullet that is intended for Robert, giving him the chance to knock Shroud down. As Robert beats Shroud violently, players will have what seems like the most important decision of the game, either to Spare Shroud or Kill him.

Now the scene plays out in a great way, showing us the reflection of Robert's face on the puddle of water as he looks down on Shroud. Firstly, the choice entirely depends on you, and you can go with any decision you want. Secondly, there is a different trophy/achievement for both options for players who are enthusiastic about collecting them all. As there are four save slots in the main menu, you can quit before this choice, save your game, to replay both options.

The choices do not massively change the final scene of the game , but there are slight differences. If you decide to kill Shroud, then during an interview with Chase, the reporter will ask about an SDN dispatcher killing Shroud . Here, Chase will defend you and not give out any information about the identity of Robert, but also say that Shroud deserved it . Afterwards, when talking to Blond Blazer, she will mention that Robert has been suspended and is pending investigation, but all of that is just a formality .

If you decide to spare Shroud, which might sound like the right thing to do to a lot of players, the cops will take Shroud away . The interview with Chase will change very slightly as the interviewer asks about the SDN dispatcher who captured Shroud . Apart from this, there aren't many changes, and the episode ends all the same.

Dispatch

item.title: World of Warcraft Fish Are Blowing Up the Midnight Beta
item.description:
The World of Warcraft: Midnight beta is having some pretty severe latency issues right now, and it seems like the improved NPC behavioral patterns of fish might be responsible. The large number of aquatic creatures along the coasts of QuelThalas and ZulAman have likely been causing some unexpected issues for World of Warcraft .

On November 11, World of Warcraft officially started the Midnight beta. This marks the next major milestone towards the release of the next expansion, which is expected to arrive in early 2026. The beta includes most of Midnight , including all four new zones: Eversong Woods, ZulAman, Harandar, and the Voidstorm.

New Fish NPC Behaviors Contribute to WoW: Midnight Beta Lag

Players on the Midnight beta have been encountering some pretty bad lag, and it seems like the source is pretty fishy. According to a post on the forums by World of Warcraft game producer Zorbrix, the developers have been trying to hunt down the cause of the performance problems in the Midnight beta since it went live, and after much investigation, it seems like fish are one of the major contributing factors. Issues with NPC behavioral improvements in World of Warcraft combined with the large number of coastlines and fish in the zones of Midnight created the perfect storm to throttle game performance across the entire realm.

Of course, the fish are almost certainly not the only issue. Zorbrix admitted it was a collection of things causing degraded server [performance] and increased memory usage on the world servers. Every squashed bug would produce two more, leading to a cascading issue. The developers are hard at work trying to fix it, but it still may be a little while before performance on the beta stabilizes. Hopefully, these issues will be resolved before World of Warcraft 's Midnight Pre-Patch event test on November 17.

All of that being said, the improvements to NPC behavior that contributed to these issues have caught the attention of many fans. Unlike many MMOs, in which monsters and NPCs simply sit around in a field until engaged in combat, the NPCs in World of Warcraft patrol, hunt, nap, forage, and even fight one another. It will be interesting to see how these improvements enhance the immersion of the new zones in Midnight and beyond.

This is far from the only glitch that has appeared during Midnight testing. From A-posing World of Warcraft Night Elves to falling through the floor of the Silvermoon Barber Shop, Midnight still has a few kinks to work out. Gamers who want to help squash these beta bugs can opt in on the WoW website, or guarantee their spot by pre-purchasing the Epic Edition of Midnight .

World of Warcraft: Midnight
